results.title: Roofs and power
results.brief_description: Highlights the attempts of government bodies to overcome some of the problems that have plagued the high-rise housing estates in Victoria, in the past and still do today (focusing on Park Towers and 229 Hoddle Street in Melbourne). Shows how Housing Commission tenants are becoming involved in the decision-making processes that determine the environment in which they live including better security, vandal-proof walls and different designs for new flats. Also profiles the range and extent of families who live in public housing with one-third single parents, 20% elderly, low income two parents large families, immigrants and homeless youth. There is a 2.1/2 to 3 year waiting list with 43,000 families living in public housing in Victoria. Discusses why these high-rise buildings were built and the political reasoning of both the Liberal and Labor parties for encouraging private ownership. Includes excellent aerial footage of Melbourne (1984). Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: Ronald Reagan
results.creator_credit: Richard Hughes, Mark Rowland, Carlton International, Mentorn International and Reel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous lives”.
From small town boy to President of the United States, Ronald Reagan never forgot the teachings of his mother’s Christian Church and its vision of America as God’s chosen country. He took the world to the brink of nuclear war, and then came close to abolishing the entire nuclear arsenal of the United States and the Soviet Union. Features rare and exclusive footage. Narrated by Lucy Longhurst.

results.title: Ron the zookeeper
results.brief_description:
Claymation story about Sushi, the last male grey panda and his reluctance to be a sperm donator to save his species from extinction.
WARNING: Contains sex scenes, coarse language and adult themes

results.title: Ron Shelley: civil engineer
results.brief_description: Typical experiences of a design engineer working on road and bridge construction in Papua-New Guinea, illustrating the development role of better communications. Discusses living conditions in Port Moresby. Ron Selley works for the Department of Public Works as a Design Engineer, has designed seventy bridges, and travels to remote areas of the Territory for his work.

results.title: Ron Barassi's top 31 players
results.brief_description: Football legend Ron Barassi selects his top 31 players from the past 31 years of Australian Rules Football. His selections (in random order) are: Michael Tuck, Leigh Matthews, Robert Flower, Gerard Healy, John Nicholls, Ted Whitten, Kevin Bartlett, Paul Roos, Doug Wade, Simon Madden, Peter Daicos, Malcolm Blight, Roger Hart, John Rantall, Keith Greig, Francis Bourke, Tony Lockett, Stephen Kernahan, Geoff Southby, Ian Stewart, Darrel Baldeck, Alex Jesaulenko, Bob Skilton, Gary Ablett, Greg Williams, Wayne Schimmelbusch, Kevin Murray, Barry Cable, Bruce Doull, Graham Farmer, Peter Hudson. Features fantastic footage of some of the legends of the game performing at the height of their careers.

results.title: Ron and Mandi Heath: weavers
results.creator_credit: Nina Syme, Terry McMahon and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
This film looks at the life style of Ron Heath, once a geologist and Mandi Heath who was a teacher, and their total commitment to their craft of weaving. They hope to make the farm on which they live self-sufficient and are continually experimenting with methods of weaving in their workshop which is in the nearby town.

results.title: Romper Room
results.brief_description: At last, the longest running and most loved television pre-school program is on video for you to enjoy with your children. Join Miss Susan, Miss Patricia, Miss Helena and Miss Megan, and of course Mr. Do Bee, for all the favourite songs and games from Romper Room.
